Title: After spoken English fears, Peller meets DDG ahead of IShowSpeed’s visit
Summary: Nigerian streamer and content creator Habeeb Hamzat, better known as Peller, has met American rapper and streamer DDG . Peller expressed doubts about his spoken English and reluctance to link up with fellow streamer IShowSpeed .

Title: Diri prostrates on The Lord’s Chosen altar, vows steady power supply in Bayelsa
Summary: Bayelsa State Governor, Senator Douye Diri, has assured the people of Baylesa State that, come the end of January 2026, they will enjoy steady light . Diri stated that Bayelsi State had been in darkness for about 29 years . He urged the people to urge people to pray for their lives .

Title: 7,000 persons get foundation’s free eye care surgery, services in Katsina
Summary: About 7,000 vulnerable persons with various eye ailments have benefited from free eye surgeries and related services, sponsored by a Non-Government Organization (NGO), Mangal Foundation . A member of the foundation’s Board of Trustees, Hussaini Kabir, disclosed this weekend .

Title: 2027: Sen Natasha shrugs off Bello’s senatorial bid in Kogi Central
Summary: Senator Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan, representing Kogi Central, has played down concerns over former Governor Yahaya Bello’s declaration to contest her senatorial seat in 2027 . She insists that the development poses no threat to her political career .

Title: Anthony Joshua: Ghami, Latif’s Janaza prayer service scheduled for London Central Mosque
Summary: The burial prayers for the departing souls of Sina Ghami and Latif Ayodele will be held this morning at 10 am in London . This was contained in the programmes shared with The Guardian on Sunday .

Title: Resident doctors to resume suspended strike January 12
Summary: Resident doctors to resume suspended strike January 12 . The Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors (NARD) has announced plans to resume its previously suspended total, indefinite and comprehensive strike with effect from Jan. 12 .

Title: Catholic priest slumps, dies while delivering homily
Summary: Rev. Stephen Chukwuma slumped and died while delivering a homily . The Parish Priest of St. John the Baptist Catholic Church, Boji-Boji Agbor, in Ika South Local Government Area of Delta State, died .

Title: Why Nigerian youths must prioritise blood pressure control
Summary: A report from the World Health Organisation (WHO) shows that no fewer than 1.3 billion adults globally live with hypertension . Nearly half unaware of hypertension, with nearly half unaware .

Title: Troops neutralise over 23 bandits in Kano-Katsina onslaught
Summary: Troops of Operation Fansan Yamma neutralised 23 bandits following coordinated attacks in Kano State between Jan. 1 and Jan. 2 . Troops engaged bandits in Shanono and Tsanyawa Local Government Areas (LGAs) after being alerted to their location .

Title: 25 dead, 14 missing in Yobe boat mishap
Summary: Boat capsized along the Yobe River in Garbi town, Nguru Local Government Area of the state . 14 others are still missing after the accident .

Title: Police probe driver assault by suspected fake officers in Ogun
Summary: The Ogun State Police Command has launched an investigation into a viral video showing a truck driver in Ijebu-Ode claiming he was pursued and assaulted by men impersonating members of the Nigerian Police Force . The driver alleged that the attackers, who identified themselves as members of a task force, broke his vehicle and threatened his life

Title: Anthony Joshua pays tribute to deceased friends in emotional post
Summary: Former world heavyweight boxing champion, Anthony Joshua, has made his first social media post since a fatal car accident in Nigeria that claimed the lives of two close friends and team members . Joshua sustained minor injuries in the incident that killed his friends, Sina Ghami and Latif “Latz” Ayodele on Monday, December

Title: 25 feared killed, 13 rescued as boat capsizes in Yobe
Summary: A canoe carrying 52 passengers capsized while travelling from Adiyani town in Guri Local Government Area of Jigawa State to Garbi town in Nguru LGA, Yobe State . 13 passengers have been successfully rescued and are receiving medical attention, while 25 bodies have been recovered .

Title: Okpebholo warns contractors against project delay, threatens contract revocation
Summary: Edo State Governor, Monday Okpebholo, has commended road contractors delivering quality jobs across Edo South Senatorial District . The governor stated this on Saturday during an inspection tour of ongoing road construction projects in the state . He said the inspection was necessary to separate serious contractors from those failing to meet agreed standards and timelines .

Title: NNPP will survive Kano crisis despite gov's possible defection — Spokesperson
Summary: National Publicity Secretary of the New Nigeria People’s Party, Ladipo Johnson, has assured that the party will withstand its internal crisis in Kano State . Johnson said the decision was taken to restore order and uphold the party's constitution . This comes amid reports of the governor's alleged move to defect to the ruling All Progress
